Product.description: Represents a product available in the Danny Store.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Product entity.

category.description: Category of the product (e.g., vêtements, chaussures, accessoires, tech-style).

numberOfReviews.description: Number of reviews for the product.

ProductVariant.title: ProductVariant
ProductVariant.description: Represents a specific variant of a product (e.g., different color or size).

id.description: Unique identifier for the ProductVariant entity.

discount.description: Discount applied to the product variant.

Order.title: Order
Order.description: Represents an order placed by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Order entity.

orderDate.description: Date and time when the order was placed.

status.description: Status of the order (e.g., pending, processing, shipped, delivered).

OrderItem.title: OrderItem
OrderItem.description: Represents an item within an order.

id.description: Unique identifier for the OrderItem entity.

quantity.description: Quantity of the product variant in the order.

price.description: Price of the product variant at the time of the order.

Review.title: Review
Review.description: Represents a product review submitted by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Review entity.

reviewDate.description: Date and time when the review was submitted.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to adhere to the principles of Authorization Independence, Structural Segregation, Access Modeling, and Data Clarity.  Authorization Independence is achieved by avoiding `get()` calls in security rules.  Path-based ownership is used for private user data. For collaborative data, a membership map (`members`) is used and denormalized where needed.

**Explanation of Paths:**

*   **/users/{userId}**: Stores user profiles. Uses path-based ownership, ensuring only the authenticated user can access their own profile.
*   **/products/{productId}**: Stores product information. Publicly accessible, so no specific authorization data is stored here.
*   **/products/{productId}/variants/{variantId}**: Stores product variants. Child of product. Publicly accessible.
*   **/users/{userId}/orders/{orderId}**: Stores orders for each user, ensuring only the user can access their orders. Path based ownership. 
*   **/users/{userId}/orders/{orderId}/items/{itemId}**: Stores order items for a specific order. Again path-based ownership.
*   **/products/{productId}/reviews/{reviewId}**: Stores reviews for each product.  Uses path-based ownership to ensure only the user can create/modify their own review.

This structure supports the required QAPs. Secure `list` operations are enabled via structural segregation (separate collections for different access needs) and path-based ownership.
